results.title: Horizon
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Normand Gregoire and Claude Jobin
results.brief_description: A film without words, a sort of tone poem where the natural sounds of the road and the view from the cab of a long-distance truck create a sense of a man in a world apart. The movement of the speeding truck and the optical manipulation of what the driver sees have a mesmerising effect. Clouds seem to gather and break like a flock of sheep. The horizon beckons elusively. The driver seems a prisoner of space and time.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Normand Gregoire and Claude Jobin

results.title: Horatio Nelson and the Battle of Trafalgar
results.creator_credit: Phil Grabsky and Seventh Art Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Great commanders”.
Nelson is considered Britain’s greatest naval hero. Throughout his early career, he was considered insuboridinate and reckless, but the genius of his miltitary leadership ensured him a place in history. His battles against rival European fleets were unparalleled successes. At the Battle of Trafalgar, Nelson ensured that Britain had mastery of the seas which brought about the subsequent expansion of the British Empire.

results.title: Hoppy: a portrait of Elizabeth Hopkins
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, John Taylor, Don Hopkins and Colin Browne
results.brief_description: Although a latecomer to the professional art scene, Elisabeth Hopkins has achieved success. In this film, the eighty-eight-year-old Canadian artist is seen, and heard, as she talks and paints her way through an interview. Fiercely independent, she lives alone and enjoys it. Scenes from her paintings, wittily underscored by a creative soundtrack, mix easily with scenes of her life on Galiano Island off the southern coast of British Columbia, and at the Bau-Xi Gallery in Toronto, where her paintings are eagerly snapped up. Elisabeth Hopkins has not allowed age to diminish her pleasure in life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, John Taylor, Don Hopkins and Colin Browne

results.title: Hoppity pop
results.brief_description: An animated film in which coloured shapes dance in time to old-fashioned calling music. The film was made without a camera, by drawing directly upon the film with ordinary pen and ink. Simple, swift moving forms dance about the screen, carrying out the mood of the music as the humorous aspect of the old time circus calliope - missing stops and a tendency to go out of tune - are all included on the soundtrack. No commentary.

results.title: Hoppin' mad [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: David McKay and David McKay Design
results.brief_description: Cold Chisel’s “Cheap wine” sing along by two travelling German tourists is rudely interrupted when their car hits a kangaroo. Not wanting to waste a photo opportunity with one of Australia’s most famous native animals, Rainer and Dirk take time out to pose with “Skippy”, with surprising results. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Hopi Indians: arts and crafts
results.brief_description: Looks at the arts and crafts of the Hopi Indians focusing on weaving, silversmithing, basket making and pottery. Records the skill and patience required in these rapidly disappearing arts.
